2052.subject: CHHS
2052.descrlong: Introduces students to the fundamental tools necessary for considering ethical questions from a variety of perspectives. Students will be able to articulate the values and ethics that are the foundation for all health and human services practice, recognize areas of conflict between professional values and the their own, and develop skills to analyze and respond to ethical problems faced in professional settings. (Offered spring semester.)

2113.subject: CHHS
2113.descrlong: Introduces students to the fundamental tools necessary for considering ethical questions from a variety of perspectives. Students will be able to articulate the values and ethics that are the foundation for all health and human services practice, recognize areas of conflict between professional values and the their own, and develop skills to analyze and respond to ethical problems faced in professional settings. 2114.subject: CHHS
2114.descrlong: Presents an interdisciplinary and multicultural introduction to professional ethics.  Using a developmental approach, this course has two functions.  The first is to provide students with a survey of moral theories.  The second function is to apply these theories to professional codes of ethics and the ramifications of ethics for appropriate interactions with clients, colleagues, organizations, and society.  We will focus specifically on the knowledge and skills related to analyzing and managing ethical predicaments in the helping professions.  (Offered every semester.)

2122.subject: CHHS
2122.descrlong: Presents an interdisciplinary and multicultural introduction to professional ethics.  Using a developmental approach, this course has two functions. The second function is to apply these theories to professional codes of ethics and the ramifications of ethics for appropriate interactions with clients, colleagues, organizations, and society.  We will focus specifically on the knowledge and skills related to analyzing and managing ethical predicaments in the helping professions.  (Offered every semester.)
